text: Elsa Sullivan Lanchester (28 October 1902 â€“ 26 December 1986) was an English actress in theatre, movies, and television.Obituary Variety, December 31, 1986. After World War I, she began performing in theatre and nightclubs. She met the actor Charles Laughton in 1927. They were married two years later. She began playing small roles in British movies. The couple moved to Hollywood. Lanchester played small movie roles. They became American citizens in 1950. She played the title character in Bride of Frankenstein (1935). She played supporting roles through the 1940s and 1950s. She was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for Come to the Stable (1949) and Witness for the Prosecution (1957). Following Laughton's death in 1962, Lanchester resumed her career with appearances in such Disney films as Mary Poppins (1964), That Darn Cat! (1965) and Blackbeard's Ghost (1968). One of her last roles was in Murder By Death (1976). ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1902 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Actors from London Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:English movie actors Category:English stage actors Category:English television actors Category:Infectious disease deaths in Los Angeles Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States
title: Elsa Lanchester
